meanings.sent1: The school board is secularizing the holiday celebrations.
meanings.sent2: She is secularizing her wardrobe by choosing more casual clothes.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to be secularizing its nap time, always sleeping during the day.
meanings.sent4: The artist is secularizing traditional art forms with modern techniques.
meanings.sent5: By secularizing the music, the composer created a piece that appeals to all audiences.

meanings.definition: To remove religious influence from something
meanings.sent1: The government is secularizing the public institutions.
meanings.sent2: They are secularizing the historical texts to make them more inclusive.
meanings.sent3: The chef is secularizing the recipe by replacing holy water with regular water.
meanings.sent4: The detective is secularizing the case, focusing only on the evidence.
meanings.sent5: Secularizing the ceremony made it accessible to people of all beliefs.
